content: The Birth of Samson(A)
Again the children of Israel did evil in the sight of the , and the  delivered them into the hand of the Philistines for forty years.
Now there was a certain man from Zorah, of the family of the Danites, whose name  Manoah; and his wife  barren and had no children.
And the Angel of the  appeared to the woman and said to her, “Indeed now, you are barren and have borne no children, but you shall conceive and bear a son.
Now therefore, please be careful not to drink wine or  drink, and not to eat anything unclean.

For behold, you shall conceive and bear a son. And no razor shall come upon his head, for the child shall be a Nazirite to God from the womb; and he shall begin to deliver Israel out of the hand of the Philistines.”

So the woman came and told her husband, saying, “A Man of God came to me, and His countenance  like the countenance of the Angel of God, very awesome; but I did not ask Him where He  from, and He did not tell me His name.

And He said to me, ‘Behold, you shall conceive and bear a son. Now drink no wine or  drink, nor eat anything unclean, for the child shall be a Nazirite to God from the womb to the day of his death.’ ”
Then Manoah prayed to the , and said, “O my Lord, please let the Man of God whom You sent come to us again and teach us what we shall do for the child who will be born.”
And God listened to the voice of Manoah, and the Angel of God came to the woman again as she was sitting in the field; but Manoah her husband  not with her.
Then the woman ran in haste and told her husband, and said to him, “Look, the Man who came to me the  day has just now appeared to me!”
So Manoah arose and followed his wife. When he came to the Man, he said to Him, “Are You the Man who spoke to this woman?”And He said, “I ”
Manoah said, “Now let Your words come  What will be the boy’s rule of life, and his work?”
So the Angel of the  said to Manoah, “Of all that I said to the woman let her be careful.
She may not eat anything that comes from the vine, nor may she drink wine or  drink, nor eat anything unclean. All that I commanded her let her observe.”
Then Manoah said to the Angel of the , “Please let us detain You, and we will prepare a young goat for You.”
And the Angel of the  said to Manoah, “Though you detain Me, I will not eat your food. But if you offer a burnt offering, you must offer it to the .” (For Manoah did not know He  the Angel of the .)
Then Manoah said to the Angel of the , “What  Your name, that when Your words come  we may honor You?”
And the Angel of the  said to him, “Why do you ask My name, seeing it  wonderful?”
So Manoah took the young goat with the grain offering, and offered it upon the rock to the . And He did a wondrous thing while Manoah and his wife looked on—
it happened as the flame went up toward heaven from the altar—the Angel of the  ascended in the flame of the altar! When Manoah and his wife saw  they fell on their faces to the ground.
When the Angel of the  appeared no more to Manoah and his wife, then Manoah knew that He  the Angel of the .
And Manoah said to his wife, “We shall surely die, because we have seen God!”

But his wife said to him, “If the  had desired to kill us, He would not have accepted a burnt offering and a grain offering from our hands, nor would He have shown us all these  nor would He have told us  as these at this time.”
So the woman bore a son and called his name Samson; and the child grew, and the  blessed him.
And the Spirit of the  began to move upon him at Mahaneh Dan between Zorah and Eshtaol.
